snippet: A state appeals court has struck down a law that held parents responsible for the criminal activity of their children.   The Second District Court of Appeal ruled Friday that the 1988 law was unconstitutional because it did not define "responsible...
lead_paragraph: A state appeals court has struck down a law that held parents responsible for the criminal activity of their children. The Second District Court of Appeal ruled Friday that the 1988 law was unconstitutional because it did not define "responsible parenting."

headline.main: Court Voids Crime Law That Aimed at Parents
